comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47201412@N02] ... and it's signed by the man himself! The famous Mr Bradfield. 

AB ... in your copious records you wouldn't have a Bradfield map of the proposed extension of the railway line to Mosman would you? (If you look north west of the tunnels at North Sydney you'll see a legend indicating the proposed extension). It would be interesting to see what he planned in the light of current debates on the subject of a second harbour rail-crossing.

It's also interesting to note that the proposed suspension bridge linking Bennelong Point and Kirribilli precurses the route followed by the Sydney Harbour Tunnel some sixty-odd years later!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] I'm not sure but I'll ask some of our collection gurus here :-D AB UPDATE: In the meantime I did a search for "map" and "plan" in the SHB photo series and found these other maps * Plan of New South Wales Government Railways Sydney and Suburban Railways * Map of birds eye view of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Approaches * Map of Sydney Harbour showing Crossings and Principal Roads & Railways * Map of Sydney and Suburban Railway System

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Birchgrove is very comprehensively rearranged on that map.   But no bridge there,  which would be a more logical place than Kirribilli.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] AB - many thanks, a few hours study here as well. Much appreciated. JFC

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06]  See 'Warringah Highway' note above ... in this sketch dated 1924 we see where it links with the Pacific and Bradfield Highways, on the northern approaches to the Sydney Harbour Bridge!

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/6057185061/in/photostream/]

Wouldn't the good people of Manly, Warringah and Pittwater of today have relished this development?

But what of the citizens of Mosman, Cremorne and Neutal Bay?

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: This map is bogus.   The map of glebe is completely wrong.   You would have to knock it all down and start again to get what it on this map for Glebe.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: And supposedly a 1929 map which doesn't have Pyrmont Bridge on it ?

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: I think the important word in the description is the word 'proposed'.

comment.author: 27331537@N06

comment._content: Thank you for all your efforts AB. I'll try to catch up with the book, I've not seen it.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] Mitch, if you look at Bradfield's title on the map it states 'Proposed' - this was his view of a future Sydney. Try looking at the plan with his eyes - it was his vision and he was sharing it. Also, you seem to be doubting the veracity of the map and NSW State Records, which is a great pity as it shows an insight into the man's mind and the way he thought.  Thanks also State Records for the trouble you go to in bringing this material out for us to view!
